Kup:

"We will get them back My friend"Said camly the male"We must to plan =
it well in order to dont have another mia"


From: Sandy 
Sent: Tuesday, Ma=
rch 16, 2010 11:31 AM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Back to the =
Ark


  
Before he could answer Kup, Tucson listens to the voice of the Mat=
rix,Kup and to Lord Elder. Once again they had caught him just in time to p=
ull him from what could have been an emotional disaster. He was thankful fo=
r that.

" I guess I don't know the difference between being too self absor=
bed and when it's all right to actually state how valuable one self is to a=
 cause. I have to stop doubting myself as far as worth is concerned. I'll k=
ick myself in the aft to improve if I have to." 

He then thinks about his =
disability and pauses for just a moment.

" Well, now that I need to kind o=
f change gears for a moment, I suppose I should see myself as an innovator,=
 who's self worth is rather valuable to the cause of turning things around =
for everyone and not just for himself. I'm not saying I'm a God, and that t=
o me would be far too fetched. But now, if I were to rate my self worth, I'=
d say my role as an Autobot is valuable. If I had not persisted in trying t=
o find out what happened to Rodimus, not only would I not have found him, I=
 would not have been able to stop the same thing from happening to others. =
And now that I do realize what's going on, and the fact that I could have n=
early fallen down the same path, which I hope never to do, thanks to all of=
 you, and the voice I keep hearing, I can finally do some real good around =
here. And I promise, I'll work with each and every one of you, to the best =
of my abilities,
and try to come up with new ways upon which to do so."

An=
other pause.

" Now that I've woken up a bit, I suppose I'd like to be able=
 to see again, I just haven't really gotten around to asking someone on how=
 to repair my visual circuitry... Heh, truth is, I'm one of the biggest pro=
crastinators on Cybertron. I guess I've just been putting it off too long, =
after getting used to not having my sight, it just became second nature to =
me. And in some respects, perhaps I did not want to actually "See" the trut=
h of the situation. And of course, major confession coming out here... At t=
he time, Ratchet was doing repairs and well I didn't want to burden him wit=
h anything... He had enough going on. After a while I completely forgot and=
 then another major war happened and before I knew it I lost track of time.=
. But now there is time for the repair. I just need to have my circuitry ex=
amined before it is repaired... I don't know the extend of my damages truth=
fully.."

He sighs.

"I'm not good at tolerating bad news, you probably alr=
eady know that."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercycl=
onus@...> wrote:
>
> > > What am I worth? How can I be worth something when=
 there are lives just starting out there that are more precious than my own=
? And how can I say I'm worth something when we have young aspiring Autobot=
s and Maximals just starting their careers as soldiers? They have their who=
le lives ahead of them, and by Primus I'm prepared to give back what's been=
 taken from them, THEIR FREEDOM!"
> 
> "All sentient being have worth young=
 Tuscon." comes that whisper again
> as Tuscon positioned himself near to t=
he body of Optimus. "If you do
> not count your self as worth anything how =
can any one else see you as
> worthy of anything?"
> 
> Even as the voice s=
poke to Tuscon, Lord Elder chimed in, unknowingly
> agreeing with the whisp=
ered voice, "You know, you sound like Rodimus.
> He used to say things like=
 that. He would get depressed when he
> failed. Even if he won the battle, =
he would sometimes find things that
> he missed."
> 
> "Yes Tuscon" the whi=
spered voice continued. "Do not tie your sense of
> self to your successes,=
 but to your efforts to achieve that success.
> Who you are defines your va=
lue, not what you have you have achieved."
> 
> Another whispered voice, al=
so presumably from the Matrix inside
> Optimus, "Tell me something Tuscon, =
we are not biological creatures
> but technological, yet you are blind, why=
 have you chosen to remain
> so? could it be because you choose to remember=
 the pain of loss or
> failure?"
> 
> Another voice whispered to Tuscon, th=
is one sounding a little like
> Optimus himself, "Do not make the mistake t=
hat Rodimus has made. He
> lost the energy matrix and himself in that loss.=
 He will need your
> help to remember his own value. Only then can the powe=
r of the matrix
> help him. But first *you* must see his value, and your ow=
n."
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
>
